title: Crimson Core
search_blob: Crimson Core Gala Abstract Art Crimson Core is a visceral abstraction that captures the fiery depth of the earth’s inner layers. Gala sculpts her surface with textured pigments of deep rust, ember-red, and glimmers of gold-revealing a world beneath the visible. The composition evokes volcanic terrain, ancient minerals, and the slow burn of transformation. This is not just a painting - it’s an excavation of memory and matter, where what’s buried pulses with life. title: Bograshov Beach
search_blob:
Bograshov Beach Merav Salman Modern Portraits A tribute to Tel Aviv’s vibrant coastline, Bograshov Beach captures the pulse of Israeli urban life through a striking interplay of movement, color, and emotion. Merav Salman channels her signature visual storytelling into this powerful piece, depicting two kitesurfers dancing over waves that blur the lines between chaos and control. The brushwork is expressive, the water almost sculptural — a physical memory of the sea. While at first glance the scene may evoke thrill and leisure, there’s an undercurrent of emotional tension. Like much of Salman's work, this painting balances energy and introspection — the sea becoming a metaphor for resilience, vulnerability, and the perpetual quest for freedom in a crowded world.
Rooted in Tel Aviv yet universally resonant, Bograshov Beach is a contemporary Israeli masterpiece that connects place, motion, and soul. Mixed Media on Canvas 27.6×59.1 in 2025.0 Available Square Masterpiece by renowned Israeli artist, Unique piece - never to be replicated, Hand-signed by the artist, Certificate of authenticity included

title: Let Go
search_blob:
Let Go Moti Nataf Sculptures Let Go is a sculptural wall piece that explores the tension between holding on and letting go – much like watching a ship fade on the horizon. The glossy red balloon, rising from a weathered copper surface with a bronze-like patina, echoes memories of childhood by the sea, where dreams are lifted by the wind, and hands must learn to release.
In Let Go, Moti Nataf extends his lifelong dialogue with the sea, this time through the universal language of longing and gentle detachment.

title: Anchor
search_blob:
Anchor Moti Nataf Sculptures Anchor by Moti Nataf is more than an object – it is a symbol of tension between weight and surrender, purpose and pause. Crafted from a 45-year-old ship’s anchor, salvaged from the depths of the sea, and paired with a heavy iron chain, the sculpture evokes both maritime function and poetic stillness. Positioned with elegance yet grounded with force, the anchor becomes a metaphor for holding, remembering, and belonging. Nataf – known for his deep connection to the sea and for working with reclaimed materials from the Jaffa coast – brings emotional precision and sculptural clarity to this piece. Whether viewed as a relic, a tool, or a monument to inner stillness, Anchor invites contemplation on stability in an ever-shifting world.

 Weathered iron (Original ship anchor & Chain) 39.4×19.7 in 2025.0 Available Square Masterpiece by renowned Israeli artist, Unique piece - never to be replicated, Hand-signed by the artist, Certificate of authenticity included
